definition: to remain/to be left/to have as remainder
leftovers from a meal/fig. remnants handed down from others
spoilt tea, leftover food (idiom); remains after a meal/crumbs from the feast

sentences.english: Problem with Orphans A gang of orphans scoured the city for scraps to live on.
sentences.chinese: 孤兒問題一羣孤兒在城裏四處搜索殘羹剩飯混時度日。

sentences.english: And they can always take their leftovers home without being embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 他們可能經常把剩飯剩菜帶回家，不必感到尷尬。

sentences.english: You will eat the scraps that he gives you and you will live 30 years.
sentences.chinese: 你要喫他的殘羹剩飯，活上30年，這就是你的歸宿。

sentences.english: You give your leftovers to the pigs, they deal with your rubbish, and you get meat.
sentences.chinese: 你把你的剩飯交給豬，它幫你處理掉，而你得到肉。

sentences.english: I ate the left-overs for two days.
Occasionally the dog will get scraps of bread and meat from the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 這隻狗偶爾能從飯館得到些殘羹剩飯。

sentences.english: She cleared the leftovers from the table.
sentences.chinese: 她清掉桌上的剩飯剩菜。

sentences.english: Using waste food to generate electricity is a good way to save the environment.
sentences.chinese: 利用殘羹剩飯來發電是個不錯的方法。

sentences.english: The asteroids we see today are the leftovers from this chaotic period.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天看到的小行星是從這個混亂時期的剩飯剩菜。

sentences.english: A jackal watches from a distance, hoping for a few scraps when the lions are done.
sentences.chinese: 遠處，一隻豺狗暗中注視，覬覦獅子的殘羹剩飯。

sentences.english: Seed can be inexpensive, and many birds will eat scraps as well.
sentences.chinese: 種子也不貴，而且很多鳥還喫剩飯。

sentences.english: I ate left-overs for two days.
Also, do not feed your pet table scraps that contain onions in any shape or form.
sentences.chinese: 也不要餵給寵物任何含洋蔥的殘羹剩飯。

sentences.english: Learn how to use leftovers in recipes.
sentences.chinese: 學會如何使用殘羹剩飯。

sentences.english: Instead they can subsist on leftovers and whatever they forage.
sentences.chinese: 可以用剩飯餵養它們，它們還可以自己外出找食。

definition: to get food at a canteen
rice congee made with red beans, lotus seeds, longan, red dates, nuts etc
to eat one's fill/to be full
non-vegetarian dish (including meat, fish, garlic, onion etc)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
